pullRequest.title: Stats: Ignore boundary when counting Content-Types
pullRequest.bodyText:
StatsPassiveScanner > Extract the content type and charset if present.
StatsPassiveScannerUnitTest > UnitTest to assert the new behavior.

Fixes #5952
Signed-off-by: kingthorin kingthorin@users.noreply.github.com

beforeCommit.message:
Stats: Ignore charset and boundary when counting Content-Types

- StatsPassiveScanner > Split the header value on semi-colon and always
use the zero'th element.

Fixes zaproxy/zaproxy#5952

Signed-off-by: kingthorin <kingthorin@users.noreply.github.com>

afterCommit.message:
Stats: Ignore charset and boundary when counting Content-Types

- StatsPassiveScanner > Extract the content type and charset if present.
- StatsPassiveScannerUnitTest > UnitTest to assert the new behavior.

Fixes zaproxy/zaproxy#5952

Signed-off-by: kingthorin <kingthorin@users.noreply.github.com>

nodes.bodyText: This could be the first trimmed entry of  ctvArray, always.
Could just ignore the boundary, e.g. create a stream, (trim/remove empties,) filter out the boundary, and join.
Could use the prefix constant (same for following checks).
